common_issues.title: Pieces OS Account Linking and Launching Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with linking Google and GitHub accounts, with only one connectable at a time.  A new account linking system is planned.  Additionally, users report Pieces OS failing to launch, potentially due to OneDrive interference or duplicate installations.  Solutions include checking OneDrive and providing log files to support.

related_issues.title: Shareable link is not generating
related_issues.text:
Shareable link is not generating
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/907584e3-3310-4866-bd26-5fbf6e371d62)
Shareable link is not generating . 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@19richa) reported an issue where they were unable to share a link.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user was unable to share a link through the Pieces app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support agent (@mark-at-pieces) requested the user's email address.
* The user provided their email address.
* The issue seems to have resolved itself.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user reported that the issue is now resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was provided with links to potentially helpful resources.
* The issue was automatically routed to the appropriate Pieces team member.

## Conclusion:

The user's issue with sharing links appears to have been resolved. It is unclear what the specific cause of the issue was, but it may have been related to the user's email address.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: Account Linking Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* User johnkennyuk was experiencing issues linking their Pieces account with GitHub and Google accounts.
* The original account linking system was outdated and not performing as expected.
* A new system was under development and scheduled to replace the old one in late February.
* johnkennyuk experienced a single character capitalization inconsistency between their Google and GitHub emails, which may have been a contributing factor.


**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking flow was problematic and not straightforward.
* An email capitalization inconsistency might have hindered the linking process.


**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support offered to manually link the two accounts.
* A new account linking system was under development and planned for release in February (later pushed to early/mid March).
* Support suggested johnkennyuk wait for the new system instead of further troubleshooting the old one.


**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The problem was not fully resolved.
* johnkennyuk agreed to wait for the new account linking system.
* Pieces support will re-engage the issue once the new system is released.

**Additional Points:**

* Pieces acknowledged the issue with the old system and is actively working on a replacement.
* The new system aims to resolve all linking issues and streamline the user experience.
* There was a slight delay in the development of the new system.
* Johnkennyuk is expected to be among the first users to test the new linking system.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation: 

**Key Points:**

* User @MR-AAYU is experiencing the issue "PiecesOS was unable to launch."
* The user provided log files and identified the location of the "log" file.
* It was discovered that the user had Pieces for Developers installed twice.
* OneDrive may be preventing Pieces from launching due to folder location.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS is unable to launch.
* Duplicate installation of Pieces for Developers.
* OneDrive potentially interfering with application launch.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Provide the log file for further investigation.
* Check OneDrive folder for com.pieces.os files and delete them.
* Book a meeting on the Pieces support calendar for further diagnosis.
* Provide information about the user's machine (Windows version, build number, CPU info, and RAM).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

The issue is still being investigated. The user is expected to provide additional information and schedule a meeting for further diagnosis and troubleshooting. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was provided with helpful resources and related issues for reference.
* The Pieces support bot automatically routed the issue to the appropriate team member.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Developers app failing to launch or connect to cloud services. This might involve non-dismissable error messages, issues with local LLM usage, or problems with Pieces OS launching. Solutions include checking internet connection, verifying Pieces installation, and reviewing log files for troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* ThemePark is experiencing issues with Pieces Desktop App on Windows 10.
* The app crashes with a message that Pieces OS is not running after 10 minutes of use.
* A non-dismissable overlay message appears when starting VS Code.

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential timing conflict between Pieces OS update and Desktop App launch on startup.
* Pieces Desktop App crashes after 10 minutes of use.
* Non-dismissable overlay message appears when starting VS Code, requiring a computer restart.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Confirming the Startup App configuration (Pieces OS vs. Desktop App).
* Investigating the timing conflict between Pieces OS update and Desktop App launch.
* Troubleshooting the cause of the crash and the non-dismissable overlay message.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* ThemePark is providing additional information and troubleshooting steps.
* The Pieces support team is investigating further.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue appears to be specific to Windows 10 and VS Code.
* ThemePark is experiencing significant disruption to their workflow.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* Rohan Rathi (@rohanrathi99) reported issues with both cloud and local Large Language Models (LLMs).
* Cloud LLM issues involved trouble making requests to PiecesOS cloud services.
* Local LLM issues involved trouble with local models.

**Problems identified:**

* Potential firewall or network configuration blocking PiecesOS outgoing requests.
* Hardware constraints affecting local LLM performance.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Reviewing logs to identify the root cause.
* Removing the personal OpenApi key for cloud LLMs.
* Using a smaller local LLM to address hardware constraints.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue with cloud LLM successfully resolved.
* Issue with local LLM likely resolved by using a smaller model.

**Next steps:**

* Monitor the situation to ensure complete resolution.
* Rohan and Mark to connect on February 25th at 22:30 to further investigate the local LLM issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS and Pieces for Developers Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching PiecesOS and Pieces for Developers on both Windows and Linux.  Issues often involve network connectivity problems, dependency errors, and potential conflicts with OneDrive.  Solutions include verifying network settings, reinstalling the applications, and checking OneDrive folder configurations.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* mariusz-kowalski reported an issue they encountered while using the Pieces Desktop App.
* The issue is related to Linux machines and involves a specific error.
* mark-at-pieces and mack-at-pieces from the Pieces support team responded to the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The exact cause of the error is unclear, but it seems to be related to Linux machines.
* The issue has been observed before on different support channels.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mack-at-pieces requested the log file from mariusz-kowalski.
* mack-at-pieces offered a video call to troubleshoot the issue live.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* mariusz-kowalski provided the log file but is unable to join a live session.
* The Pieces support team will likely analyze the log file to investigate the issue further.

**Note:** The conversation did not include any solutions implemented or a final outcome.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces OS and Ollama installations, resulting in Cuda errors or the inability to connect to LLMs. This might involve Pieces OS launching its own Ollama instance despite an external installation. Solutions include reinstalling Ollama, ensuring correct installation order, and verifying network connectivity for cloud-based LLMs.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on Ollama server issues in Pieces OS

**Key Points Raised:**
*  John is experiencing issues with the Ollama server on his Pieces OS installation, specifically Cuda errors.
* He has tried reinstalling both the server and Pieces OS several times, but the problem persists.
* He suspects that the issue might be related to the startup order of Ollama and Pieces OS, as the server only seems to work if he restarts it separately after logging into Pieces OS.

**Problems Identified:**
* Incorrect Cuda dlls are being used.
* Conflicting Ollama installations. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Reinstall Ollama using the OllamaSetup.exe installer. 
* Clean previous installation before re-installation.
* Update to Pieces OS version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The problem was temporarily fixed by reinstalling, but it reappeared after updates and re-installs.
* The latest update to Pieces OS 11.1.2 may have fixed the race condition causing the problem. 

**Additional Information:**

* John uses winget for installations and uninstalls. 
* He has uninstalled both Ollama and Pieces OS, then re-installed Ollama first, and then re-installed Pieces OS, but Pieces OS still ignores the existing Ollama instance.
* The issue might only occur if John logs into Pieces OS quickly enough that Ollama starts before Pieces OS attempts to launch it.

**Next Steps:**

* The issue requires further investigation to identify the root cause and implement a permanent fix. 
* A call between John and Brian might be necessary to further debug and diagnose the problem.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** User (@waseem852) is unable to use Ollama in Pieces despite trying various installation methods. 

**Key Points:**

* User installed Ollama through Pieces, manually, and via winget, but none worked.
* User uninstalled and reinstalled Ollama multiple times, even using Task Manager.

**Solutions:**

* Brian (@brian-at-pieces) suggested shutting down both Pieces apps after uninstalling Ollama.
* User confirmed they did this but the issue persisted.
* Brian proposed a call to debug the issue further.
* User agreed to the call.

**Outcome:**

* Brian requested the user's email to schedule a call.
* No further updates are available in the conversation.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is unresolved, but a call is scheduled to further investigate and attempt to resolve it.

* Rohan and Mark to connect on February 25th at 22:30 to further investigate the local LLM issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS LLM Integration Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS struggling to connect with both cloud-based and local Large Language Models (LLMs) like Ollama. This often manifests as error messages related to cloud service connectivity or local LLM setup. Proposed solutions include verifying network connectivity, checking firewall settings, ensuring sufficient hardware resources for local LLMs, and using smaller models. Direct support and debugging sessions are often required to fully resolve these issues.

This conversation reports an issue with high CPU usage and slow performance on Pieces OS (Linux Mint 22.1). The Pieces team is investigating the issue and will follow up with the user.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* Rohan Rathi (@rohanrathi99) reported issues with both cloud and local Large Language Models (LLMs).
* Cloud LLM issues involved trouble making requests to PiecesOS cloud services.
* Local LLM issues involved trouble with local models.

**Problems identified:**

* Potential firewall or network configuration blocking PiecesOS outgoing requests.
* Hardware constraints affecting local LLM performance.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Reviewing logs to identify the root cause.
* Removing the personal OpenApi key for cloud LLMs.
* Using a smaller local LLM to address hardware constraints.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue with cloud LLM successfully resolved.
* Issue with local LLM likely resolved by using a smaller model.

**Next steps:**

* Monitor the situation to ensure complete resolution.
* Rohan and Mark to connect on February 25th at 22:30 to further investigate the local LLM issue.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** User (@waseem852) is unable to use Ollama in Pieces despite trying various installation methods. 

**Key Points:**

* User installed Ollama through Pieces, manually, and via winget, but none worked.
* User uninstalled and reinstalled Ollama multiple times, even using Task Manager.

**Solutions:**

* Brian (@brian-at-pieces) suggested shutting down both Pieces apps after uninstalling Ollama.
* User confirmed they did this but the issue persisted.
* Brian proposed a call to debug the issue further.
* User agreed to the call.

**Outcome:**

* Brian requested the user's email to schedule a call.
* No further updates are available in the conversation.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is unresolved, but a call is scheduled to further investigate and attempt to resolve it.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers launch issues:** These issues are widespread, affecting both Windows and Linux users, and significantly impact user experience.
**Investigate and address Ollama integration challenges:** Conflicts between Pieces OS and Ollama installations are causing frustration for users attempting to leverage local LLMs.

**Improve account linking functionality:** The current system is outdated and causing persistent issues for users trying to link multiple accounts.  The planned new system should be thoroughly tested and implemented quickly.

**Provide clear guidance on network connectivity and firewall settings:** Many reported issues stem from potential conflicts in these areas. Clearer documentation and troubleshooting steps would help users resolve these issues independently.

**Optimize Pieces OS resource management:**  Investigate reports of high CPU usage and slow performance, particularly on Linux.  This may involve optimizing internal processes or providing users with better control over resource allocation.

**Enhance communication about planned new features and improvements:**  Keep users informed about the timeline for the new account linking system and other updates to manage expectations and reduce support tickets related to known issues.

**Consider developing a dedicated troubleshooting guide for common issues:**  This could include step-by-step instructions, FAQs, and links to relevant documentation to empower users to resolve problems independently.
